However, the currently viewed section is orange highlighted while the previously watched section are shown in blue. Subsequently the timeline also purposes as a user trace or macro viewing history.   The mentioned assignments can be considered as assessment tasks. Beside multiple or single choice formats also fill-in tasks are presented to activate the user or foster reflection of the previously learned stuff. In all seen cased the lecturer introduced and explained the question to the viewer. So the position and content of these in-video assessments has been considered during the production of the video.  In the "dash board" users can view their progress in learning by means of previously and currently watched videos.
name: Udacity

description: vi-wiki is an extension for MediaWiki to add spatio-temporal hyperlinks to HTML5 videos of wiki pages. These links can be annotated directly in the player on the article page or in the creole source view. In the creole markup it is also possible to define the videos. Each video including its annotations is put into a closure. Within that it is also possible to concatenate multiple videos into a sequence.
name: vi-wiki

description: A course is split into different chapters that contain several sections of multiple videos. This sequence of sections and videos is mapped as a navigation panel on top of the video player.  The player is vertically split between the video and a quiz. These little assignments (multiple choice) are permanently presented next to the video without any temporal relation.  Further more different playback rates and quality levels of the video can be selected.
name: iversity

description: openHPI provides several computer science related online courses. A course runs for six to eight weeks. In every week a sequence of learning materials is offered. Videos can be followed by self assessments, literature recommendations or introducing texts. The video player is vertically split in two parts. On the right the lecturer video can be seen and on the left is another video of presentation slides or desktop screens. The proportion of size can be changed by a slider handle. The playback speed is adjustable.
name: openHPI

availability: Online Available als Open Educational Resource.
description: IWRM education is a hypervideo learning environment about integrated water resources management. It incorporates more then 40 lectures that are categorized and tagged. Each video is synchronized with slide images. On these slides appear temporal links to other videos. Two types of links were distinguished: 1) standard links that lead to a temporal position in another video, and 2) cycle links that work like the first type, but include a return link to the link source for a dedicated period of time.  The chapters or sections can be accessed in a table of content.  IWRM education provides further more a full-text search on all slides of teh videos.  The software was build in javascript, HTML, and CSS. Therefor it can be used without a server as a por­ta­ble stand-​​alone web application.
name: IWRM education
provider: IHP/HWRP Secretariat, Federal Institute of Hydrology, Germany

description: Since its foundation the Khan Academy has changed its way of learning design. Starting from assignments videos serve as an aid to explain concepts that are necessary to fullfil the assignment.  The video player delivers YouTube videos but is able to show a transcript below. Also the playback speed is adjustable in case HTML5 is set as default at YouTube. Some videos are provided with assessment tasks.
name: Khan Academy

description:
At Wiki Commons a few thousand videos are stored that were published under a free license or that are royalty-free. The videos are severed in many different formats, resolutions and quality levels. Sequential browsing is enabled by a nice and accessible interface.
Wiki Commons can be considered as the media database for different projects of the Wikimedia Foundation. First of all Wikipedia uses Wiki Commons as media backend.
name: Wiki Commons

description:
Amara is an advanced tool to annotated video subtitles in different languages. The creation process consists of three steps: 

1.  select video URL as well as source and target language, 
2.  type what you hear by the help of keyboard shortcuts, 
3.   synchronize the lines to its exact positions, 
4.   review the captions and publish it including a translation for the title and an abstract.  

The timeline in step 2 is zoomed into detail. In contrast to other timelines the annotation stays at a fixed position while the timeline scale moves behind it on playback. Because the annotations need to be synchronized one by one it makes sense.  Unfortunately the strict wizards does not allow to go a step back.   Beside that users can leave notes that are related to the video as a whole.
name: Amara / Universal Subtitles

description: As a digital library for Internet Archive stores also a great amount of video footage. The videos are filed into different collections and sub-collections.  Comparable to a playlist users can collect certain videos as bookmarks. This resource-related bookmarks are public available as RSS feed. In the player scenes can be previewed on the timeline. When a videos has ended related resources are presented.
name: Internet Archive

description: Plumi is a plone video portal offering typically video portal functions (e.g. playlist, search, video manager). Remarkable for the player is  feature for multilingual subtitles.
name: Plumi

availability: Online available as source code and video demo.
description: Hyperaudio Pad is another realization of the the Video Wiki that facilitated video editing through manipulating the transcript text. By dragging phrases of video transcript to another text field users can remix the order and arrangement of the corresponding video scenes. Hyperaudio Pad also allows it to remix parts of multiple video into one. Technically they make use of media fragments.   See concept, demo video, and source code:  http://happyworm.com/blog/2011/08/08/the-hyperaudio-pad-a-software-product-proposal/   http://happyworm.com/screencams/hyperaudiopad/2013-04-04/demo1-standard.m4v https://github.com/maboa/hyperaudiopad  Recently they launched it as commercial service: http://hyperaud.io/pad/
name: Hyperaudio Pad

availability: Online available for viewing. To create such contents a registration is needed.
description: Touchcast is service for production and presentation of interactive videos. Users can capture videos with their tablets by using two cameras.   The content inside the portal is organized in channels. Further more categories for featured and trending videos are available.   The essential feature of the video player is the opportunity to watch content on demand. On demand content could be a video, a image or a web page. While watching these contents the source video stays visible as a thumbnail (e.g. for videos on demand) or continues to play in a small window (e.g. for images on demand). In both cases the minimized source video works as a return link. Beside that additional content can be displayed on top of the video as an overlay. Touchcast allows the user to add various content types. Beside just displaying images they could also be activated to become a link to a external resource. If the users feels disturbed by an overlay he/she can remove it.  All annotations (on demand and overlays) are mapped on the timeline for quick access. Very nice is idea to animate the slider handle when jumping to a point on the timeline.
name: touchcast
